required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of MYOBLOC速 Followed by Open-Label Multiple-Treatment With MYOBLOC速 in the Treatment of Troublesome Sialorrhea in Adult Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multicenter, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Single-Treatment Efficacy and Safety Study of MYOBLOC速 (Part A) Followed by Open-Label, Multiple-Treatment With MYOBLOC速 (Part B) in the Treatment of Troublesome Sialorrhea in Adult Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of MYOBLOC in the treatment of Sialorrhea (drooling), which can be a symptom of many disease conditions. MYOBLOC will be injected directly into the salivary glands. MYOBLOC has been shown in previous trials to safely decrease saliva production, thereby demonstrating its potential as a safe and effective treatment for troublesome sialorrhea.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Unstimulated Salivary Flow Rate (USFR) at Week 4 Post-injection Visit (Part A)
primary_outcome.description: Change weight of expectorated saliva at a Week 4 post-injection visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impression Change (CGI-C) at Week 4 Post-injection (Part A)
primary_outcome.description: CGI-C was assessed on a 7-point scale ranging from "very much improved" to "very much worse" with 1 assigned to "very much improved" and 7 assigned to "very much worse"; ranging from a minimum score of 1 and a maximum score of 7.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive specified dose of MYOBLOC
Subjects will receive specified dose of MYOBLOC
Subjects will receive volume matched Placebo

intervention.description: MYOBLOC (rimabotulinumtoxinB) Injection, or botulinum toxin type B, is the "B" serotype of botulinum toxin. It is the only commercially available "B" serotype, and also the only available botulinum toxin that does not require reconstitution for use.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Seeking treatment for troublesome sialorrhea for at least 3 months that is occurring secondary to any disorder or related to any cause
- Investigator sites will review entire list of inclusion criteria with potential subjects
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any known prior exposure to botulinum toxin type B, or known adverse reaction or sensitivity to botulinum toxin type A, or known sensitivity to any of the MYOBLOC solution components.
- Prior botulinum toxin treatment to the salivary glands at any time
- Investigator sites will review entire list of exclusion criteria with potential subjects

results_reference.citation: Chinnapongse R, Gullo K, Nemeth P, Zhang Y, Griggs L. Safety and efficacy of botulinum toxin type B for treatment of sialorrhea in Parkinson's disease: a prospective double-blind trial. Mov Disord. 2012 Feb;27(2):219-26. doi: 10.1002/mds.23929. Epub 2011 Sep 1.
Ondo WG, Hunter C, Moore W. A double-blind placebo-controlled trial of botulinum toxin B for sialorrhea in Parkinson's disease. Neurology. 2004 Jan 13;62(1):37-40.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 33 sites including United States, Russia and Ukraine.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: DB: Double Blind (Part A) OL: Open Label (Part B)

group.title: DB: MYOBLOC 2500 U
group.description: Participants will receive specified dose of MYOBLOC

group.title: DB: MYOBLOC 3500 U
group.description: Participants will receive specified dose of MYOBLOC

group.title: DB: Placebo
group.description: Participants will receive volume matched Placebo

group.title: OL: ALL MYOBLOC
group.description: All Participants were to receive 3500 U MYOBLOC but could receive lower doses at investigator discretion.

participants_list.participants: No placebo group in Part B.
61 from 2500 U group, 57 from 3500 U group, 52 from Placebo group continued to Part B
No placebo group in Part B.

group.title: MYOBLOC 2500 U
group.description: Subjects were dosed per treatment assignment of 2500 U MYOBLOC.

group.title: MYOBLOC 3500 U
group.description: Subjects were dosed per treatment assignment of 3500 U MYOBLOC.

group.title: PLACEBO
group.description: Placebo was dosed as an exact match of MYOBLOC.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Unstimulated Salivary Flow Rate (USFR) at Week 4 Post-injection Visit (Part A)
outcome.description: Change weight of expectorated saliva at a Week 4 post-injection visit.
outcome.population: The per protocol included subjects with a minimum USFR of 0.2 g/min.

group.title: MYOBLOC 2500 U
group.description: Subjects were dosed per treatment assignment of 2500 U MYOBLOC.

group.title: MYOBLOC 3500 U
group.description: Subjects were dosed per treatment assignment of 3500 U MYOBLOC

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo was dosed as an exact match of MYOBLOC.

measure.title: Unstimulated Salivary Flow Rate (USFR) at Week 4 Post-injection Visit (Part A)
measure.description: Change weight of expectorated saliva at a Week 4 post-injection visit.
measure.population: The per protocol included subjects with a minimum USFR of 0.2 g/min.

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impression Change (CGI-C) at Week 4 Post-injection (Part A)
outcome.description: CGI-C was assessed on a 7-point scale ranging from "very much improved" to "very much worse" with 1 assigned to "very much improved" and 7 assigned to "very much worse"; ranging from a minimum score of 1 and a maximum score of 7.
outcome.population: Per protocol the intent-to-treat population who were injected with study medication and had at least 1 post injection CGI-C measurement up to week 4 (inclusive).

group.title: MYOBLOC 2500 U
group.description: Subjects were dosed per treatment assignment of 2500 U MYOBLOC.

group.title: MYOBLOC 3500 U
group.description: Subjects were dosed per treatment assignment of 3500 U MYOBLOC.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo was dosed as an exact match of MYOBLOC.

measure.title: Clinical Global Impression Change (CGI-C) at Week 4 Post-injection (Part A)
measure.description: CGI-C was assessed on a 7-point scale ranging from "very much improved" to "very much worse" with 1 assigned to "very much improved" and 7 assigned to "very much worse"; ranging from a minimum score of 1 and a maximum score of 7.
measure.population: Per protocol the intent-to-treat population who were injected with study medication and had at least 1 post injection CGI-C measurement up to week 4 (inclusive).

reported_events.time_frame: Part A: 13-Week Post-Injection Period; Part B: 4 Sessions of 13-Week (+/- 2 Weeks) Post-Injection Periods
reported_events.desc: Part A (Session 1): Serious TEAEs Reported During Double-Blind Phase (Safety Population) Part B (Sessions 2-5): Serious TEAEs Reported During Open-Label Phase (OL Population)

group.title: MYOBLOC 2500 U (Part A)
group.description: Participants received specified dose of MYOBLOC. Participants were evaluated for 13 weeks following the injection.

group.title: MYOBLOC 3500 U (Part A)
group.description: Participants received specified dose of MYOBLOC. Participants were evaluated for 13 weeks following the injection.

group.title: Placebo (Part A)
group.description: Participants received volume matched Placebo. Participants were evaluated for 13 weeks following the injection.

group.title: OL: ALL MYOBLOC (Part B)
group.description: Participants received Open Label treatment with 3500 U (decreased dose at investigator discretion) every 13 weeks for a maximum of 4 treatment sessions.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor has the first right, within 9 months following the later to occur 1) close out meeting or 2) Sponsor possessing all data, to publish the lead paper. Following the foregoing, Institution has the right to publish the results provided the Institution provides a Publications Committee, which includes the Sponsor, with a draft at least 30 days before submission. At Sponsor's request, Institution shall withhold publication for 45 days to allow filing of a patent application.
